_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



VWR International, headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, is a global laboratory supply and

distribution company. VWR is ready to support your production facility with reliable access to raw materials and essential supplies; provide innovative, high quality products for life science labs; provide products and processes in the healthcare industry; supply enhanced access to over 100,000 Safety & Industrial Supplies; provide a selected portfolio specifically designed to help prevent potential contamination and maintain aseptic conditions in cleanrooms and controlled environments; provide lab furniture; and provide comprehensive information and services on chromatography instruments, software, and consumables for a wide variety of chromatography techniques and applications.



The VWR International management is not only committed to offering superior supplies and

services, but also to maintaining a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities. VWR International's safety and environmental policies are administered by the Distribution Manager with the assistance from the Regulatory Affairs and Environmental Health & Safety Manager, who all conduct periodic inspections of the facility to ensure compliance, and will oversee the entire safety and environmental programs, including the RMP Program.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



VWR is located at 1050 Satellite Boulevard Northwest, in Suwanee, Georgia.  The facility is approximately 0.05 miles west of Interstate Highway 85.  The area immediately surrounding the facility is urban with a mixture of commercial, industrial, and residential areas. The primary business of VWR International is a chemical storage/distribution facility. The regulated substances of concern are hydrochloric acid and chloroform. Chloroform is stored in 55 gallon drums, while hydrochloric acid greater

than 37% concentration is stored in 2.5 liter, 5 liter, and 55 gallon containers. The containers are delivered by freight companies. The containers remain onsite until they are purchased by a customer, at which point they are picked up for delivery to the client.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION

STEPS



In order to operate the storage and distribution facility, VWR International complies with the EPA Risk Management Program. In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed. The facility is also ISO 9001 certified.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no significant releases that exceeded the Federal Reportable Quantities of 10 lbs of chloroform or 5,000 pounds of Hydrochloric acid, or the state requirement mandating immediate reporting of any release or threatened release of a hazardous material in the past five years (August 2010 - August 2015).  In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from a release of an RMP regulated substance, nor any releases or "near misses" that warranted an internal incident investigation.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The Hazard Review, performed on August 11, 2015, generated mitigation measures

(recommendations) to improve safety at the VWR International facility located in Suwanee, Georgia. The mitigation measure include additional training, key maintenance-related tests/inspections, enhanced emergency response policies and procedures. The VWR International safety committee is planning to complete several items, including the recommendations, over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees. These changes include the following items:



- Continue to train all employees in the facility Safety/Plan Programs.

- Continue to have employee involvement in Safety/Plan development.

- Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.

- Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.

- Recommendation tracking for the technical studies is maintained by the Environmental, Health, Safety & Security Manager.
